definitions.text: a document granting an inventor sole rights to an invention
an official document granting a right or privilege
grant rights to; grant a patent for
make open to sight or notice
examples: His behavior has patented an embarrassing fact about him

definitions.text: (of a bodily tube or passageway) open; affording free passage
clearly revealed to the mind or the senses or judgment
examples: the effects of the drought are apparent to anyone who sees the parched fields
it is plain that he is no reactionary
